article.title: Authentication
article.para: Our application now has all the features it needs. The only thing missing is some kind of user management. Every owner should be able to add and edit his/her pets and add visits, but should not be able to do this with the pets of other owners. So we have to know, which owner is currently using the system. We need some kind of authentication.
In this chapter we will add a simple login to our application

section.title: Adding authentication data to the database
section.para: First we need to handle some kind of login information. For this we create a database table users to store it. This table needs a reference to the corresponding owner or vet. Unfortunately we currently have no common table for owners and vets. Owners and vets already have some data in common, so it seems naturally to create a common base-table. We name it persons and we put the first_name and last_name into it. The users table then can reference the table persons.
